channel.title: life on Kuldeep Singh
channel.description: Recent content in life on Kuldeep Singh

item.title: Speaker | Gatherverse Book Summit 2025
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: üì¢ Gatherverse Book Summit 2025: Exploring Books, Language and Meaning in the Age of New Technology. In the intersection of emerging technologies and humanity, this GatherVerse event aims to deep dive into the current and future state of books in an age defined by artificial intelligence. This is a space for authors, researchers, engineers, ethicists, educators, publishers, technologists and readers. We explore what it means to write, publish, and trust books in a time where machine-generated language is flooding the landscape

item.title: üìï Available Now! Jagjeevan : Living Larger than Life
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: üìï Jagjeevan: Living Larger Than Life is a heartfelt tribute to the extraordinary life and timeless wisdom of Shri Jagguram‚Äîan enlightened soul whose values shaped generations. Blending personal memories with profound life lessons, it captures the essence of a man who lived with humility, discipline, compassion, and unwavering purpose. Through ten insightful chapters, the book explores heritage, resilience, responsibility, inner strength, family unity, conflict resolution, gratitude, and the power of one‚Äôs actions.

item.title: üìï Coming Soon! Jagjeevan : Living Larger than Life
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Life teaches us lessons every single moment‚Äîbut only when we pause to reflect do we truly grow. Everyone faces challenges; no life is free from problems. What defines us is not the struggle, but how we rise above it. Most challenges we encounter today are the same ones our previous generations faced‚Äîwhether they relate to daily life, relationships, earning, spending, or navigating responsibilities. So much wisdom already exists around us, in our homes, in our traditions, in the stories of our elders.

item.title: Books
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: üìï Jagjeevan Living Larger than Life üìï Jagjeevan: Living Larger Than Life is a heartfelt tribute to the extraordinary life and timeless wisdom of Shri Jagguram‚Äîan enlightened soul whose values shaped generations. Blending personal memories with profound life lessons, it captures the essence of a man who lived with humility, discipline, compassion, and unwavering purpose. Through ten insightful chapters, the book explores heritage, resilience, responsibility, inner strength, family unity, conflict resolution, gratitude, and the power of one‚Äôs actions.

item.title: How Small, How Big: Seeing Life Through the Lens of the Universe
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: After a few hectic months, I recently visited a camping site with my family ‚Äî a truly refreshing experience being close to nature. The trip was hosted by Camp Gopika and accompanied by Astrostop, adding a unique touch to our stay. The serene environment gave me time to reflect on life and also work on the final touches of my upcoming book, üìï ‚ÄúJagjeevan ‚Äì Living Larger than Life‚Äù, which tells the story of my great-grandfather and his belief that travel is essential for learning and introspection.

item.title: Some moments
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: How Small, How Big - The Nature Trip - Oct, 2025 Sky Diving - An experience - Sep, 2025 18th Anniversary Ritu & Kuldeep - Feb, 2025 44th Anniversary of Parents - Jun, 2024 Book in parent’s Hand - May, 2024 Vrindavan - Mar, 2024 House warming ceremony and RakshyaBandhan - Aug, 2023 Jim corbett trip - Jun, 2023 Lakshya’s visit to Thoughtworks Gurugram - May, 2023 16th Wedding anniversary - Feb, 2023 Father Retirement Speech - Jun, 2022 ‚òû More Details Welcoming Aarav Remotely!

item.title: Open-sources and Apps
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Gen AI Hands On Practices Google Colab Hands-on practice for developing Gen AI applications, and understanding the concepts. ‚òû Github ‚òû Learn More SSO Proxy A lightweight proxy tool for accessing APIs and websites that require SSO authentication. It uses Puppeteer to open a browser window for login and then reuses the authenticated cookies to access the proxied URL. This tool is particularly helpful for: Showcasing integration with portal APIs that require SSO (before SSO is actually set up).

item.title: TW Spotlight: Going with the Flow ‚Äì My Journey
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Thoughtworks has always amazed me‚Äîwhether it’s the pioneering work we do in the industry or the contributions we make to software engineering practices. What truly inspires me is our people-centered approach. Recently, I was honored by our market leadership, who put me in the spotlight to share my journey with fellow Thoughtworkers. While I’ve learned a great deal from my colleagues, I took this opportunity to share my own experiences in the hope of inspiring others.

item.title: 20 reflections of 20 years
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)

item.title: My thoughtworkings from five thoughtful years
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Thoughtworks is celebrating its 30th year in industry, and I have completed five years here, and to celebrate this, I have compiled thoughts from thoughtworkers, and published them as an ebook. I am grateful for the wealth of knowledge and experiences shared by my colleagues. These thoughts have resonated with me and shaped my journey within the organization and life. I am excited to launch the ebook with this post. I believe this compilation of thoughts will not only serve as a personal reflection but also as a valuable resource for others on their own professional journeys.

item.title: Habit Matters - The change is a side effect
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: ‚ÄúChange is the only constant, it doesn’t matter whether we like it or not, it takes place‚Äù- shared and reflected in my change stories. Over the years, I have been following my theory of change Accept-Observe-Absorb. It helped me to traverse through the change year 2020, and understand the role of ‚ÄúWill‚Äù and how to cultivate it. I shared how just one change ‚Äúworking from my native home‚Äù brought so many other changes in lifestyle and behavior.

item.title: Corporate lessons from a Home Makeover
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Recently I shared an article on my life lessons from my father‚Äôs work life, and mentioned that I dedicated a new home to my father‚Äôs work life, also promised that I will share some corporate lessons learned from making-over this new home. I can well relate my takeaways to the corporate experiences such as vendor selection, negotiation, solutioning, estimation, prioritization, agility and being a trusted partner and many more.. As I keep saying ‚Äúwe learn every day in all situations of life, good or bad‚Äù

item.title: Lessons of Life - Father‚Äôs Retirement
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: I started thinkuldeep.com keeping in mind that we learn every day in all situations of life, good or bad. Our learning matures by sharing, we explore more of us by giving it away to others. Recently my father turned 60, and has retired from government services. 60 years full of life is a quite big experience, where around 38 years he spent in serving the same Govt of Rajasthan.

item.title: My impactful change stories
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Recently, I have been invited to share my 3 years Thoughtworks Journey, at ‚ÄúImpact Series‚Äù by Social Change Group TW, India. “Striving for positive social change is at the heart of our purpose, culture and work” ‚Äî /thoughtworks I believe an impactful change is the change that changes you, and any social change start from within, our own journey. I shared my change journey, and received number of comments, and feedbacks.

item.title: The Learning Equation
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Today, The world is celebrating teacher‚Äôs day. I wish Happy Teacher’s day to all of us! We all are teachers and learners as every one of us has something to learn from others and something to teach others. I am thinking of an equation of learning that defines my way of learning and hope it would be helpful for you too. The learning equation ‚Äî Learning is proportional to Sharing; Learning ‚àù Sharing

item.title: Two Thoughtful Years!
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: It‚Äôs now two years since I accepted a challenging change to leave the previous organization after 13 long years, and join ThoughtWorks. Any change requires sacrifices and dedication before it becomes a positive change, but the journey becomes easy when we believe in the change and accept it. A change introduces us to a new environment and enables new thoughts, and new energy. The two years journey at ThoughtWorks is no different.

item.title: 2020 ‚Äî The year of Change
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Change is the only constant, early we accept, early we get ready for the future. 2020 is a year of change, accept it, and change our lifestyle and get ready for the future. I have been writing about the change in the past, right from accepting the change to change for good to have a purposeful and balanced life and uncover human potential in this Covid19 time. Today, June 20, is my younger son Lovyansh‚Äôs 3rd Birthday, and June month is really time to rejuvenate and celebrate for the kids when they are free from school.

item.title: Uncovering the human potential
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Covid19 has challenged the way work, I have penned down my earlier article to cover my workday and our shift toward new ways of working. Covid19 has impacted not just the way we work, but also our lives. All-day, we keep hearing how it is hitting hard on humanity and it has brought so much negativity around us. Enough of negativity, let‚Äôs uncover human potential to cop with it. In this article, I will cover how the ways of our regular life are shifting, and uncovering new human potentials to try out new things and performing our chores own our own.
